entries.npc_1_1: I recently came into possession of a datadisc that would be of great interest to the Alliance. Care to handle the delivery for me?
entries.npc_1_2: I recently met an exceptional young lady. She may have certain -- gifts, if you take my meaning. I understand an Imperial stormtrooper is bringing her in for questioning. Would you mind escorting her here before the Imperials pick her up?
entries.npc_1_3: I recently hired someone to acquire some grenades. He accepted payment and got the grenades but has been reluctant to actually deliver them. I was wondering if you'd go get them from him?
entries.npc_2_1: I thought you might be interested. You have that on-the-go look about you. Bring this disc to Teng Winstel -- he's one of my contacts in the Alliance. May the Force be with you, my friend.
entries.npc_2_2: That's what I hoped you'd say.
entries.npc_2_3: Ah, I thought you might enjoy a bit of shadier work. I suppose it takes a rogue to spot one. Karn Wilder is your quarry. He's not terribly trustworthy, but I never thought him so stupid as to cross me.
entries.npc_3_1: No problem. I'll find someone else. Good luck to you.
entries.npc_3_2: Not your style, eh? Don't worry about it, I'm sure somebody will be willing to help her.
entries.npc_3_3: I guess it was a bit much to ask of you. Forget I mentioned it.
entries.npc_4_1: I beat Han Solo's Kessel Run speed record! Granted, I wasn't hauling any cargo at the time, but it still counts. Now, about that job offer --
entries.npc_4_2: I mean that she may have some ability to use the Force. She's already had some run-ins with the Empire, so I need a decision, if you please.
entries.npc_4_3: Well, yes. Technically that's still true. It wasn't me doing the smuggling, was it? I still occasionally help procure scarce items for the Alliance. I do have bills to pay, after all. Now, your decision?
entries.npc_reward_1: Well done, my friend. Thank you for your help. Feel free to see me again if you need more work.
entries.npc_reward_2: You've been a big help. We can't let the Empire continue its wretched work. By all means, contact me again if you need more work.
entries.npc_reward_3: A stellar job, if I may say so. I'd say you have an impressive future ahead of you -- a much better place for the future than behind you, no?
entries.player_1_1: Sure, I've got nothing else to do.  Tell me what you need.
entries.player_1_2: Sure.  I'll make sure she gets here before the Imperials get her.
entries.player_1_3: Sure, I'll get them from him.
entries.player_2_1: No thanks.  I don't want to get conned by some 'reformed smuggler'.
entries.player_2_2: Sorry, but that's not my type of work.
entries.player_2_3: No, I'm not mixing myself up with explosives.  Sorry.
entries.player_3_1: Why would I have heard of you?
entries.player_3_3: Why grenades? Didn't you say you weren't a smuggler any more?
entries.player_reset_1: I'm sorry, but I didn't know this had to do with the Rebellion.  I can't do this for you anymore.
entries.player_sorry_1: Not yet.  I'm about to meet up with him soon.
entries.npc_backtowork_1: He doesn't have all day.  Could you please hurry?
entries.npc_reset_1: No problem. I'll find someone else. Good luck to you.
entries.cantwork: I'm sorry, friend. It seems you still have unfinished work. Seek me out when your job is completed.
entries.dontknowyou_1: Sorry, but I'm waiting for a friend.
entries.npc_work_1: So, did Teng get the package yet?
entries.npc_work_2: Were you able to save her in time?
entries.npc_work_3: So, were you able to get the grenades from him?
entries.npc_breech_1: Are you the one with this 'important' package I'm supposed to wait for?
entries.npc_breech_2: Okay... I'm reaching out with my mind...
entries.npc_breech_3: You're not getting anything from me. Die!
entries.notit_3: I said grenades, friend.  I don't know what this is, but it's sure not a case of grenades.
entries.npc_backtowork_2: Okay, but you may not have much time left.  Please hurry.
entries.npc_backtowork_3: Hmph.  You could've just said you hadn't got around to it yet.  Let me know when you have, okay?
entries.npc_reset_2: Not your style, eh? Don't worry about it, I'm sure somebody will be willing to help her.
entries.npc_reset_3: I guess it was a bit much to ask of you. Forget I mentioned it.
entries.player_reset_2: You know, I don't want to get involved with this 'Force' stuff.  Sorry, but I'm no longer interested.
entries.player_reset_3: I'm actually a bit afraid of grenades.  What if he throws one at me?  I can't do this after all.
entries.player_sorry_2: Not yet.  I was making sure there was a safe way out of there first.
entries.player_sorry_3: Ummm... he hid them, and... ummm... I just found out where.  I'm going to get them right now.
entries.npc_takeme_2: I'm not sure why people think I have a connection with the Force. Ever since that idea got around, my life has been lots more interesting.
entries.dontknowyou_2: Huh?  Oh, sorry about that.  I'm... um... practicing a role for an audition.
entries.dontknowyou_3: What?  You're not dead?  Hmm... I'll have to work on that a little more.
entries.npc_smuggle_1: I wonder what BoShek's found now? He does infiltrate himself into the most unusual situations. Thanks.
entries.next: Maybe I can find you some more work later. Take care of yourself.
